item.title: Collision Course? A Comet Heads for Mars
item.description: A recently discovered comet will make an uncomfortably-close planetary flyby next year — but this time it’s not Earth that's in the cosmic crosshairs.

item.title: XCOR Announces Significant Propulsion Milestone on Lynx Suborbital Vehicle
item.description: XCOR Aerospace today announced a first in aviation and space history, the firing of a full piston pump-powered rocket engine. This breakthrough is the foundation for fully reusable spacecraft that can fly multiple times per day, every day.

item.title: Mars' Moons: Facts About Phobos & Deimos
item.description: The two small bodies that orbit the red planet raise a number of questions about the formation of the early solar system.

item.title: UFO Memo Is FBI's 'Most Wanted' Record
item.description: A memo recounting a strange story about three 'flying saucers' in New Mexico has been viewed nearly a million times in the past two years.

item.title: One-Day Soyuz Trip to Space Station Explained | Video
item.description: NASA astronauts Bob Behnken and Mike Fossum explain how a one-day trip to the International Space Station on Russia’s Soyuz space capsules work.

item.title: WATCH LIVE @ 3pm ET: Pre-Launch Press Conference for ISS Crew
item.description: See video of the next crew to launch toward the International Space Station in a March 27 broadcast. Liftoff on Thursday, March 28.

item.title: Spring's 1st Full Moon Tonight Is Early Easter Treat
item.description: Easter falls on the first Sunday following the "Worm Moon."

item.title: Mars Rover Curiosity's 7 Biggest Discoveries (So Far)
item.description: Curiosity has been busy since landing on the Red Planet on Aug. 5, 2012.

item.title: New Theory of How Giant Stars Grow Unveiled
item.description: Scientists have been stumped on how baby stars can get so big.

item.title: NASA 'Super Guppy' Swallows Supersonic NASA Jets (Photos)
item.description: NASA's Super Guppy Transport plane ferried a pair of retired supersonic jets to Texas last week.

item.title: William Shatner 'Appalled' by IRS 'Star Trek' Spoof
item.description: A "Star Trek" spoof funded by taxpayer dollars upsets William Shatner.

item.title: Cosmic Swirl | Space Wallpaper
item.description: This amazing space wallpaper from ESO’s Very Large Telescope at the Paranal Observatory in Chile shows NGC 1637, a spiral galaxy located about 35 million light-years away in the constellation of Eridanus (The River).

item.title: Space Photographer Brings Amazing Night Sky Views Down to Earth
item.description: An exhibit at a gallery in Brooklyn is showing off some amazing photography done by one man on his driveway in Connecticut.

item.title: Amazing Space Photos by Robert Gendler (Gallery)
item.description: Expert astrophotographer Robert Gendler shares his pictures of the cosmos with SPACE.com.

item.title: Space History Photo: Inspection Institute Aeronautical Science Group
item.description: A display of a turbojet engine is shown during investigation at the Aircraft Engine Research Laboratory of NACA.

item.title: Moon and Jupiter Shine Among Trees in Stunning Photo
item.description: Photographer VegaStar Carpentier captured this dazzling view of the moon and Jupiter on March 17, 2013.

item.title: 'Star Trek' Stunt Warps Drones Into Urban Frontier
item.description: A sky full of commercial unmanned aircraft is not far off.

item.title: Solar System's Mysterious Rock Origin Puzzle Revealed
item.description: Chondrules, one of the solar system's first solids, heated up in regions far away from the sun, scientists think.

item.title: Whoa! Mini-Supernovas Discovered
item.description: A new class of supernova represents a miniature star explosion.

item.title: Apollo 13 Souvenir Rakes In $84,100 in Space History Auction
item.description: Artifacts from the early years of NASA's space program were sold yesterday (March 25).

item.title: Astronaut's Home Videos Show How to Cook in Space
item.description: It's not all peanut butter and honey sandwiches at the International Space Station for astronaut Chris Hadfield.

item.title: Star Quiz: Test Your Stellar Smarts
item.description: Are you a star at star trivia?

item.title: Edgar Mitchell: Sixth Man on the Moon
item.description: Ed Mitchell's experience aboard Apollo 14 launched his exploration of the nature of human consciousness.

item.title: Stuart Roosa: Apollo 14 Command Module Pilot
item.description: Stuart Roosa's skills were put to the test when a docking mechanism didn't work.

item.title: Mars Rover Curiosity Resumes Science Work After Computer Glitch
item.description: Curiosity had been recovering from a memory issue since late February.

item.title: The Search For Another Earth | Video
item.description: Is our galaxy filled with life? Or is Earth a beautiful, lonely aberration? Astronomers are rapidly discovering planets orbiting other stars. Will any be worth exploring up close? Could humans – or whatever we become – live there someday?

item.title: Splashdown! SpaceX Dragon Capsule Returns to Earth
item.description: SpaceX's Dragon capsule splashed down in the Pacific Ocean earlier today (March 26).

item.title: Next ISS Crew Gets Look At Soyuz Before Launch | Video
item.description: Expedition 35, the next crew heading to the International Space Station on board a Russian Soyuz capsule, got a look at the spacecraft a head of their launch on March 28th.

item.title: Jeff Bezos' Apollo Rocket Engines Land in Kansas for Conservation
item.description: The Kansas Cosmosphere and Space Center will oversee the restoration of Jeff Bezos' vintage NASA Apollo rocket engines.

item.title: Soyuz Rocket Rolls Out for ISS Crew Launch (Photos)
item.description: See photos of the Soyuz rocket to launch NASA and Russian astronauts to the International Space Station in a single day on March 28.

item.title: Space Shuttle Enterprise Added to Historic Places Registry
item.description: NASA's space shuttle Enterprise not only made history, now it is history … literally.

item.title: Space History Photo: HL-10 In Flight After Launch
item.description: The HL-10 lifting body is seen in flight during a test.

item.title: Bathed in Red | Space Wallpaper
item.description: This stunning space wallpaper reveals ALMA antennae bathed in red light. Appearing in the background are the southern Milky Way on the left and the Magellanic Clouds at the top. This image was released March 5, 2013.

item.title: Comet and Northern Lights Dance Together in Dazzling Video
item.description: The 80-second video featuring Comet Pan-STARRS was shot March 20 in northern Sweden.

item.title: Comet Pan-STARRS and the Dancing Northern Lights (Photos)
item.description: See amazing photos of the Comet Pan-STARRS and the northern lights by stargazers.

item.title: Space Oddity: Music Experience Aims to Emulate Cosmos
item.description: A new artistic experience in New York City gives audience members a new way of viscerally experiencing what space could be like.

item.title: SpaceX Dragon Cargo Capsule Heading Back to Earth
item.description: SpaceX's Dragon capsule is returning to Earth after 3 weeks attached to the International Space Station.

item.title: Landing Day Photos: SpaceX's 2nd Dragon Cargo Mission
item.description: See photos of SpaceX's second Dragon spacecraft leaving the International Space Station in March 2013 during the second private cargo mission for NASA.

item.title: Caltech Challenges Students to Plan Manned Mission to Mars Moon
item.description: The Caltech Space Challenge runs all week.

item.title: Promising Comet ISON Stars in Webcast Tonight: How to Watch Live
item.description: The Slooh Space Camera webcast of Comet ISON begins at 7 p.m. ET (2300 GMT).

item.title: LEGO Toys Returning from Space Station on Private Cargo Ship
item.description: Astronauts in space are sending their LEGO toys back home.

item.title: SpaceX Dragon Capsule Returns to Earth Tuesday: How to Watch Live
item.description: Dragon will depart the space station at 6:56 a.m. EDT and splash down in the Pacific Ocean 5 1/2 hours later.

item.title: Cosmic Playtime: Toys in Space (Photos)
item.description: Disney's Buzz Lightyear isn't the only toy to actually fly in space.

item.title: SpaceX's Dragon: First Private Spacecraft to Reach Space Station
item.description: The Dragon spacecraft first reached the International Space Station in 2012.

item.title: Ever-Changing Venus Superstorm Sparks Interest
item.description: Scientists are unsure why Venus' vortex evolves as it does.

item.title: Stellar Geyser | Space Wallpaper
item.description: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has captured a new image of Herbig-Haro 110, a geyser of hot gas flowing from a newborn star as seen in this beautiful space wallpaper.

item.title: NASA 'Super Guppy' Swallows Supersonic Jets (Photos)
item.description: NASA's giant 'Super Guppy' transport plane is so big it can fit two T-38 training jets inside.

item.title: Active Aurora Frames Comet Pan-STARRS Over Lapland | Time-Lapse Video
item.description: Astrophotographer Chad Blakley (lightsoverlapland.com) captured the comet on the horizon and northern lights at Abisko National Park on March 23rd, 2013. You can join Chad on one of his photo expeditions. Check Here: facebook.com/lightsoverlapland

item.title: Space History Photo: Firing Room #2 During Apollo 12 CDDT
item.description: A view of firing room #2 during a test for the Apollo 12 launch.

item.title: LIVE Webcast at 7 pm ET Tonight: See Comet ISON from Slooh Telescope
item.description: The online Slooh Space Camera will provide free live views of Comet ISON tonight at 7 p.m. ET (2300 GMT).
